title: Tortellini Alfredo with Grilled Chicken Breasts

Ingredients.4: 1 pinch Italian seasoning, or to taste

Ingredients.5: 1 pinch garlic powder, or to taste

Ingredients.6: 1 kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.13: 2 pinches Italian seasoning, or to taste

Ingredients.14: 1 freshly ground black pepper to taste

Directions.1: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.

Directions.2: Place chicken in a bowl and add oil, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, kosher salt, and pepper. Toss to coat.

Directions.3: Cook chicken on the preheated grill until no longer pink in the centers and the juices run clear, about 6 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Remove from the grill and allow to cool.

Directions.4: Meanwhile, fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil; stir in tortellini and return to a boil. Cook uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the tortellini float to the top and the filling is hot, about 3 minutes. Drain and set aside; keep warm.

Directions.5: Slice chicken breast into bite-size pieces.

Directions.6: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook, 2 to 3 minutes. Add cream and heat to room temperature, about 3 minutes more. Stir in Parmesan cheese and allow to melt, 2 to 3 minutes. Add Italian seasoning and pepper. Bring to a slow boil for about 1 minute before tossing in cooked tortellini and grilled chicken breast.
